repo_overview: EduResource Hub is a client-side web application that provides a curated directory of 300+ educational resources across various categories. Built with vanilla HTML, CSS, and JavaScript, it offers search and filtering capabilities to help students, educators, and lifelong learners discover quality educational materials. The project follows a simple static website architecture with JSON-based data storage and Python server support for local development.

architecture.pattern: Client-Side Rendering with JSON Data Store

frontend.styling: styles.css (Global styles with CSS custom properties)

backend.server: server.py (Python HTTP server for local development)

architecture.data_flow: User Request → HTML/CSS/JS → Fetch resources_clean.json → Client-side filtering → Render cards → Display results
architecture.deployment: Static hosting capable (GitHub Pages, Netlify, Vercel, etc.)

file_summaries.index.html: Main landing page with hero section, search bar, filter controls, and dynamic resource grid. Implements responsive navigation with mobile menu toggle. Displays statistics (300+ resources, 50+ categories). Includes developer profile section and social links.
file_summaries.about.html: About page describing the platform's mission, vision, and values. Features team member information (Amar Jaleel), statistics grid, and social media links. Contains inline CSS styles separate from main stylesheet.
file_summaries.blog.html: Static blog page showcasing 6 educational blog posts with placeholder content. Topics include online learning tips, EdTech trends, study strategies, etc. Uses card-based layout with inline CSS.
file_summaries.contact.html: Contact page with contact information display and a non-functional contact form (no backend handler). Includes email, location, phone info, and social media links. Also uses inline CSS.
file_summaries.styles.css: Comprehensive stylesheet with CSS custom properties for theming. Implements responsive design with mobile-first approach, flexbox/grid layouts, smooth transitions, and consistent design system (colors, shadows, spacing).
file_summaries.script.js: Core application logic handling: resource loading from JSON, search functionality with 300ms debounce, multi-criteria filtering (category, type, access), dynamic filter population, card rendering, and results count display. Well-structured with clear separation of concerns.
file_summaries.server.py: Python-based development server with CORS support, auto-browser launch, and proper error handling. Serves static files on port 8000. Professional implementation with emoji-based logging.
file_summaries.start-server.bat: Windows batch file to start Python server. Simple one-liner for Windows users.
file_summaries.extract_resources.py: Utility script to extract complete resources from resources_fixed.json. Validates required fields, cleans escaped characters, provides statistics on categories/types. Creates resources_complete.json output.
file_summaries.extract_robust.py: Enhanced version of extraction script with manual line-by-line parsing to handle malformed JSON. More resilient to formatting errors. Provides detailed statistics and top categories breakdown.
file_summaries.resources_clean.json: Primary data file containing 306 complete educational resources. Each resource has: Title/Name, Type, Category, Link, Short Description, Why it's useful for students, Access type. Note: Contains escaping issue with 'Why it\\'s useful for students' field.
file_summaries.resources_fixed.json: Original/legacy resource file with 3228 lines. Appears to be the source data before cleaning and extraction. May contain incomplete or malformed entries.
file_summaries.2.json: Unknown purpose file with 371 lines. Not referenced in any code. Possibly a backup or intermediate processing file.
file_summaries.README.md: Comprehensive documentation covering features, usage, installation, file structure, customization guide, and future enhancements. Well-written with clear examples and multiple setup options (Python, Node.js, VS Code Live Server).

issues_detected.description: The 'Why it\\'s useful for students' field in resources_clean.json contains incorrect escape sequences. Should be 'Why it's useful for students' with proper escaping.
issues_detected.impact: May cause parsing issues in some environments. JavaScript handles it currently but it's not valid JSON according to strict parsers.
issues_detected.fix: Re-run extraction script with proper JSON escaping or bulk find-replace in resources_clean.json

issues_detected.description: about.html, blog.html, and contact.html each contain large blocks of duplicate inline CSS instead of using the main styles.css
issues_detected.impact: Increased page weight, maintenance burden, inconsistent styling, poor code reuse
issues_detected.fix: Extract common styles to styles.css or create separate CSS files for each page. Reduce duplication by 80%+.

issues_detected.description: Contact form in contact.html has no form action, no backend handler, and no client-side validation or submission logic
issues_detected.impact: Users cannot actually send messages. Form appears broken/non-functional.

issues_detected.description: While Font Awesome icons are used, there are no explicit alt text or aria-labels for many decorative vs functional icons
